description:
New UK teacher training guidelines are pushing educators to "disrupt the centrality of whiteness" by questioning basic concepts like meritocracy and objectivity in a bid to combat racism in classrooms.

The post Teachers Will Be Trained to Challenge “Whiteness” in Schools appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Teachers Will Be Trained to Challenge “Whiteness” in Schools

description:
Politics professor James Alexander examines the sinking of the Bayesian from a Bayesian perspective. What were the odds?

The post Why Did the Bayesian Sink? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Why Did the Bayesian Sink?

description:
Eugyppius takes stock of the recent fatal knife attacks in Germany and how the usual state media "Diversity Explainers" are already working to undermine our pattern-recognition systems.

The post Diverse Man Interrupts “Festival of Diversity” in Solingen by Stabbing Eleven People, Killing Three appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Diverse Man Interrupts “Festival of Diversity” in Solingen by Stabbing Eleven People, Killing Three

description:
French authorities have arrested Pavel Durov, the billionaire founder of Telegram, the world's seventh-largest messaging app, over claims that its lack of moderation has enabled criminal activity.

The post Billionaire Founder of Telegram Arrested in France appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Billionaire Founder of Telegram Arrested in France

description:
With DEI seemingly on the way out, Joanna Gray offers a fix for the HR void left by fading diversity initiatives – one that fosters true company unity without stressing divisions based on immutable characteristics.

The post DEI Is Dead. Long Live HR appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: DEI Is Dead. Long Live HR

description:
The Education Secretary shelved the Higher Education (Freedom of Speech) Act in part because British universities wanted to protect their commercial operations in authoritarian states such as China.

The post Government Dropped Free Speech Law Because Universities Feared it Would Jeopardise the Funds They Receive From Authoritarian Regimes, Including China appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Government Dropped Free Speech Law Because Universities Feared it Would Jeopardise the Funds They Receive From Authoritarian Regimes, Including China

description:
Ed Miliband's efforts to blame the £149 rise in the energy price cap on the last government are laughably hopeless, says Ben Pile in the Daily Sceptic.

The post Lies, Damned Lies and Ed Miliband’s Tweets appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Lies, Damned Lies and Ed Miliband’s Tweets

description:
A summary of the most interesting stories in the past 24 hours that challenge the prevailing orthodoxy about the ‘climate emergency’, public health ‘crises’ and the supposed moral defects of Western civilisation.

The post News Round-Up appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: News Round-Up
